anything will get any better so given

address

conditions that we have here in the US

where there was the ability to
accumulate in sectors of the working

Financial stability it was called the

class their experience was elevated to
one of uh you know what Engles would

with stability with two automobiles the
two kids two and a half dogs or

the black part of the working class
lived under conditions virtually of AP
parite up until

the fact that we were the Imperial core
we still are but this super profits
super exploitation that we did of the

you also had a strong alternative U

upon which the reality of that stability
is
based what has happened to those factors
while the uh unions have been utterly

this thing that calls itself the left

fetish and in terms of class position by

um you had of course the

The Institute repr

the ability to accumulate the ability to

they have what every basically every
American experiences which is drowning
in
debt difficulties figuring out how to

American
public is living paycheck to paycheck
that means they're one paycheck away

the
650,000 homeless people living in a

they've seen other forms of cultural

in all what existed of that middle class
has died it has been repr
proletarianized and the lives of the

uh destruction of that material base of

thoughts that people have at the
ideological level uh accounted for the

that has been the case the fact that
only 11% of the American public actually
believes in what the mainstream media
says it's a historic fact what we have
in our hands is a crisis of
legitimacy the way the world has worked
is no longer working for American
working people and now they're conscious
of it they don't want to keep on going
on in the old way and given the crisis
of imperialism that we have even the

go on in the old way and as good
leninists we know what that means when
neither the working people nor the

the old way one of the interesting

these people are just painted by the

a politician within the context of
capitalism fulfills the things he
promises it's like it's very bad form
for them to do that but for the American
people
people that was an exciting Paradigm the
ability to have the jobs that provided
their parents or their grandparents the
stability that they were raised
listening
to the problem is that you know
capitalism is a system that has certain

therefore increased the rate of profit
so that cannot be undone within the
confin of a society that produces for
the sake of profit and capital
accumulation and not for the sake of
meeting human needs so we have this
crisis in our hands where the working
class is uh rocking the boat
ideologically they're no longer
believing the ideas of the past and not
like in previous eras it's generalized
across the whole working population and
it cannot be undone because in previous

in you know um uh promote the productive

that's virtually impossible um it would
go against the logic of the system
itself so it's a very interesting time
to be a communist in the US um and I I
think this is what creates the context
or the need for an organization such as
the

the rate of profit for investing in
